Song.title: When I Survey
Song.copyright: Words & music by Isaac Watts Additional words & music by Devon Kauflin © 2008 Sovereign Grace Praise

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [E B | E/G# A (2x)]
Verse 1: When I sur[C#m7]vey the [B/D#]wondrous [E]cross On which the [C#m7]Prince of Glory [Bsus]died [B] My richest [B/D#]gain[E] [ ]I count but [F#m]loss [E/G#] And pour con[F#m7]tempt on [B]all my [E]pride [| A | E/G# | A]
Verse 2: Forbid it, [C#m7]Lord, that [B/D#]I should [E]boast Save in the [C#m7]death of Christ, my [Bsus]God [B] All the vain [B/D#]things[E] [ ]that charm me [C#m7]most I sacri[F#m7]fice them to His [C#m7]blood [ | E | A | B]
Verse 3: See, from His [C#m7]head, His [B/D#]hands, His [E]feet Sorrow and [C#m7]love flow mingled [Bsus]down [B] Did e’er such [B/D#]love and sorrow [C#m]meet Or thorns com[F#m7]pose so rich a [A]crown? [||: E B | E/G# A :||]
{key:F#} Verse 4: [C#sus | C#sus C#] [ ]Were all the [F#]realms of nature [F#/A#]mine That were an [D#m]offering far too [C#sus]small [C#] Love so a[F#/A#]mazing, so di[D#m]vine Demands my [G#m7]soul, my life, my [||: G#m | F#/A# | B | F# :||]all
Bridge: I give my [F#maj7]life, I give my [B]all To follow [F#/A#]You, to follow [B]You
Tag: [F# F#2 | F#maj7 Bmaj7 :|| F#]
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 when i survey the wondrous cross on which the prince of glory died my richest gain i count but loss and pour contempt on all my pride verse 2 forbid it lord that i should boast save in the death of christ my god all the vain things that charm me most i sacrifice them to his blood verse 3 see from his head his hands his feet sorrow and love flow mingled down did eer such love and sorrow meet or thorns compose so rich a crown verse 4 were all the realms of nature mine that were an offering far too small love so amazing so divine demands my soul my life my all bridge i give my life i give my all to follow you to follow you tag

Arrangement.text:
VERSE 1: [D]When I survey the wondrous cross On which the Prince of Glory died My richest gain I count but loss And pour contempt on all my pride
VERSE 2: [D]See from His head, His hands, His feet Sorrow and love flow mingled down Did ever such love and sorrow meet Or thorns compose so rich a crown.
CHORUS: [G]O the wonderful [D/F#]cross, O the [G]wonderful [D/F#]cross Bids me [G]come and die and [D/F#]find that I May [A]truly live O the [G]wonderful [D/F#]cross, O the [G]wonderful [D/F#]cross All who [G]gather here by [D/F#]grace draw near And [A]bless Your name.
VERSE 3: [D]Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast Save in the death of Christ, my God All the vain things that charm me most I sacrifice them to His blood
VERSE 4: [D]Were the whole realm of nature mine That were an offering far too small Love so amazing, so divine Demands my soul, my life, my all.
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 when i survey the wondrous cross on which the prince of glory died my richest gain i count but loss and pour contempt on all my pride verse 2 see from his head his hands his feet sorrow and love flow mingled down did ever such love and sorrow meet or thorns compose so rich a crown chorus o the wonderful cross o the wonderful cross bids me come and die and find that i may truly live o the wonderful cross o the wonderful cross all who gather here by grace draw near and bless your name verse 3 forbid it lord that i should boast save in the death of christ my god all the vain things that charm me most i sacrifice them to his blood verse 4 were the whole realm of nature mine that were an offering far too small love so amazing so divine demands my soul my life my all
